title: Rename app, switch odds to fractional /1 input, and add Android APK instructions

requirements.text: Rename the app everywhere it is user-visible from "Race Predictor" to the exact new name: "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" (including the header title text, the app icon alt text, and the HTML document title).

quotes: Change the app name to "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser"

acceptanceCriteria: The header (AppHeader) shows "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" as the app title.
The app icon image alt text uses "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser".
The browser tab/document title is "GTA Online Horse Track Guesser" (frontend/index.html title updated).

requirements.text: Update the race entry odds input UI to use fractional odds with a fixed denominator of "/1": each contender row must have a single numeric input for the numerator only, display a constant "/1" immediately next to it (not editable), and show "-/1" as the blank state.

quotes: I want the odds to be put in as a "1/1, or 29/1," fractional kind of style with "-/1" as the blank.
The odds field should be 1 numeric box for the first number of the odds (before the "/"), and the second should be a constant "/1" instead of a box.

acceptanceCriteria: In the New Entry flow, each contender (1â€“6) shows a single numeric field for the numerator and a non-editable "/1" suffix.
When the numerator is empty, the UI reads as "-/1" (e.g., placeholder '-' in the numerator field with the visible '/1' suffix).
The app continues to store and use odds as numeric values for prediction/learning (numerator interpreted as X in X/1).
Validation errors remain in English and still prevent prediction/save when odds are missing or <= 0.

requirements.text: Update all odds displays in the UI to render odds in the same fractional format "{numerator}/1" instead of showing a raw number (e.g., in History contender badges).

quotes: I want the odds to be put in as a "1/1, or 29/1," fractional kind of style...

acceptanceCriteria: In History, each contender badge renders odds like "#3 (29/1)" rather than "#3 (29)".
No part of the UI displays contender odds as a plain decimal/float placeholder example (e.g., remove or update "Enter odds (e.g., 2.5)" to a fractional example).

requirements.text: Add an in-app, English-language help section that explains how to get a usable Android APK from the deployed web app by wrapping the site URL in a WebView using a website-to-APK generator (include the steps and the example site mentioned in the conversation).

quotes: Also, please tell me how to download this as a usable apk. for android.

acceptanceCriteria: The app UI contains a clearly discoverable "Android APK" (or similar) help area that provides step-by-step instructions.
The instructions mention that this is a web app and describe the approach of using a WebView wrapper, including the example generator URL "websitetoapk.com".
All help text is in English.

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not edit any paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.frontend.immutablePaths.
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko; no additional backend services or databases.
nonGoals: Generating or signing an actual Android APK inside this project.
Implementing external authentication methods beyond Internet Identity.
